ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by shortening or condensing the original work but leaving the nature and content of the original work substantially unchanged. For substantial modifications that result in the creation of a new work, see author
ROW.label: Abridger

ROW.definition: A person or organization who 1) reworks a musical composition, usually for a different medium, or 2) rewrites novels or stories for motion pictures or other audiovisual medium.
ROW.label: Adapter

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization to whom the correspondence in the work is addressed
ROW.label: Addressee

ROW.definition: A person or organization that reviews, examines and interprets data or information in a specific area
ROW.label: Analyst

ROW.definition: A person contributing to a moving image work or computer program by giving apparent movement to inanimate objects or drawings. For the creator of the drawings that are animated, see artist
ROW.label: Animator

ROW.definition: A person who makes manuscript annotations on an item
ROW.label: Annotator

ROW.definition: A person or organization who appeals a lower court’s decision
ROW.label: Appellant

ROW.definition: A person or organization against whom an appeal is taken
ROW.label: Appellee

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the submission of an application or who is named as eligible for the results of the processing of the application (e.g., bestowing of rights, reward, title, position)
ROW.label: Applicant

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating an architectural design, including a pictorial representation intended to show how a building, etc., will look when completed. It also oversees the construction of structures
ROW.label: Architect

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a musical work by rewriting the composition for a medium of performance different from that for which the work was originally intended, or modifying the work for the same medium of performance, etc., such that the musical substance of the original composition remains essentially unchanged. For extensive modification that effectively results in the creation of a new musical work, see composer
ROW.label: Arranger

ROW.definition: A person (e.g., a painter or sculptor) who makes copies of works of visual art
ROW.label: Art copyist

ROW.definition: A person contributing to a motion picture or television production by overseeing the artists and craftspeople who build the sets
ROW.label: Art director

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work by conceiving, and implementing, an original graphic design, drawing, painting, etc. For book illustrators, prefer Illustrator [ill
ROW.label: Artist

ROW.definition: A person responsible for controlling the development of the artistic style of an entire production, including the choice of works to be presented and selection of senior production staff
ROW.label: Artistic director

ROW.definition: A person or organization to whom a license for printing or publishing has been transferred
ROW.label: Assignee

ROW.definition: A person or organization associated with or found in an item or collection, which cannot be determined to be that of a Former owner [fmo] or other designated relationship indicative of provenance
ROW.label: Associated name

ROW.definition: An author, artist, etc., relating him/her to a resource for which there is or once was substantial authority for designating that person as author, creator, etc. of the work indicative of provenance
ROW.label: Attributed name

ROW.definition: A person or organization in charge of the estimation and public auctioning of goods, particularly books, artistic works, etc.
ROW.label: Auctioneer

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a work that is primarily textual in content, regardless of media type (e.g., printed text, spoken word, electronic text, tactile text) or genre (e.g., poems, novels, screenplays, blogs). Use also for persons, etc., creating a new work by paraphrasing, rewriting, or adapting works by another creator such that the modification has substantially changed the nature and content of the original or changed the medium of expression
ROW.label: Author

ROW.definition: A person whose manuscript signature appears on an item
ROW.label: Autographer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for a resource upon which the resource represented by the bibliographic description is based. This may be appropriate for adaptations, sequels, continuations, indexes, etc.
ROW.label: Bibliographic antecedent

ROW.definition: A person who binds an item
ROW.label: Binder

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the binding design of a book, including the type of binding, the type of materials used, and any decorative aspects of the binding
ROW.label: Binding designer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for writing a commendation or testimonial for a work, which appears on or within the publication itself, frequently on the back or dust jacket of print publications or on advertising material for all media
ROW.label: Blurb writer

ROW.definition: A person or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by being responsible for the entire graphic design of a book, including arrangement of type and illustration, choice of materials, and process used
ROW.label: Book designer
ROW.variant3: Designer of book; Designer of e-book

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the production of books and other print media
ROW.label: Book producer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the design of flexible covers designed for or published with a book, including the type of materials used, and any decorative aspects of the bookjacket
ROW.label: Bookjacket designer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the design of a book owner's identification label that is most commonly pasted to the inside front cover of a book
ROW.label: Bookplate designer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who makes books and other bibliographic materials available for purchase. Interest in the materials is primarily lucrative
ROW.label: Bookseller

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by embossing Braille cells using a stylus, special embossing printer, or other device
ROW.label: Braille embosser

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in broadcasting a resource to an audience via radio, television, webcast, etc.
ROW.label: Broadcaster

ROW.definition: A person or organization who writes in an artistic hand, usually as a copyist and or engrosser
ROW.label: Calligrapher

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a map, atlas, globe, or other cartographic work
ROW.label: Cartographer

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a resource by pouring a liquid or molten substance into a mold and leaving it to solidify to take the shape of the mold
ROW.label: Caster

ROW.definition: A person or organization who examines bibliographic resources for the purpose of suppressing parts deemed objectionable on moral, political, military, or other grounds
ROW.label: Censor

ROW.definition: A person responsible for creating or contributing to a work of movement
ROW.label: Choreographer

ROW.definition: A person in charge of photographing a motion picture, who plans the technical aspets of lighting and photographing of scenes, and often assists the director in the choice of angles, camera setups, and lighting moods. He or she may also supervise the further processing of filmed material up to the completion of the work print. Cinematographer is also referred to as director of photography. Do not confuse with videographer
ROW.label: Cinematographer

ROW.definition: A person or organization for whom another person or organization is acting
ROW.label: Client

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of photographic prints from film or other colloid that has ink-receptive and ink-repellent surfaces
ROW.label: Collotyper

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for applying color to drawings, prints, photographs, maps, moving images, etc
ROW.label: Colorist

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the commentary or explanatory notes about a text. For the writer of manuscript annotations in a printed book, use Annotator
ROW.label: Commentator for written text

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new work (e.g., a bibliography, a directory) through the act of compilation, e.g., selecting, arranging, aggregating, and editing data, information, etc
ROW.label: Compiler

ROW.definition: A person or organization who applies to the courts for redress, usually in an equity proceeding
ROW.label: Complainant

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a musical resource by adding music to a work that originally lacked it or supplements it
ROW.label: Composer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the creation of metal slug, or molds made of other materials, used to produce the text and images in printed matter
ROW.label: Compositor

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the original idea on which a work is based, this includes the scientific author of an audio-visual item and the conceptor of an advertisement
ROW.label: Conceptor

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for documenting, preserving, or treating printed or manuscript material, works of art, artifacts, or other media
ROW.label: Conservator

ROW.definition: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is called upon for professional advice or services in a specialized field of knowledge or training
ROW.label: Consultant

ROW.definition: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who is engaged specifically to provide an intellectual overview of a strategic or operational task and by analysis, specification, or instruction, to create or propose a cost-effective course of action or solution
ROW.label: Consultant to a project

ROW.definition: A person(s) or organization who opposes, resists, or disputes, in a court of law, a claim, decision, result, etc.
ROW.label: Contestant

ROW.definition: A person(s) or organization defending a claim, decision, result, etc. being opposed, resisted, or disputed in a court of law
ROW.label: Contestee

ROW.definition: A person or organization relevant to a resource, who enters into a contract with another person or organization to perform a specific
ROW.label: Contractor

ROW.definition: A person, family or organization responsible for making contributions to the resource. This includes those whose work has been contributed to a larger work, such as an anthology, serial publication, or other compilation of individual works. If a more specific role is available, prefer that, e.g. editor, compiler, illustrator
ROW.label: Contributor

ROW.definition: A person or organization listed as a copyright owner at the time of registration. Copyright can be granted or later transferred to another person or organization, at which time the claimant becomes the copyright holder
ROW.label: Copyright claimant

ROW.definition: A person or organization to whom copy and legal rights have been granted or transferred for the intellectual content of a work. The copyright holder, although not necessarily the creator of the work, usually has the exclusive right to benefit financially from the sale and use of the work to which the associated copyright protection applies
ROW.label: Copyright holder

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is a corrector of manuscripts, such as the scriptorium official who corrected the work of a scribe. For printed matter, use Proofreader
ROW.label: Corrector

ROW.definition: A person or organization who was either the writer or recipient of a letter or other communication
ROW.label: Correspondent

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization that designs the costumes for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment
ROW.label: Costume designer

ROW.definition: A court governed by court rules, regardless of their official nature (e.g., laws, administrative regulations)
ROW.label: Court governed

ROW.definition: The person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by preparing a court’s opinions for publication
ROW.label: Court reporter

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the graphic design of a book cover, album cover, slipcase, box, container, etc. For a person or organization responsible for the graphic design of an entire book, use Book designer; for book jackets, use Bookjacket designer
ROW.label: Cover designer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the intellectual or artistic content of a resource
ROW.label: Creator

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization conceiving, aggregating, and/or organizing an exhibition, collection, or other item
ROW.label: Curator

ROW.definition: A person or organization that submits data for inclusion in a database or other collection of data
ROW.label: Data contributor

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for managing databases or other data sources
ROW.label: Data manager

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization to whom the resource is dedicated
ROW.label: Dedicatee

ROW.definition: A person who writes a dedication, which may be a formal statement or in epistolary or verse form
ROW.label: Dedicator

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is accused in a criminal proceeding or sued in a civil proceeding
ROW.label: Defendant

ROW.definition: A organization granting an academic degree
ROW.label: Degree granting institution

ROW.definition: A person or organization executing technical drawings from others' designs
ROW.label: Delineator

ROW.definition: An entity depicted or portrayed in a work, particularly in a work of art
ROW.label: Depicted

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a design for an object
ROW.label: Designer

ROW.definition: A person responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance, a radio or television program, etc.
ROW.label: Director

ROW.definition: A person who presents a thesis for a university or higher-level educational degree
ROW.label: Dissertant

ROW.definition: A place from which a resource, e.g., a serial, is distributed
ROW.label: Distribution place

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by an architect, inventor, etc., by making detailed plans or drawings for buildings, ships, aircraft, machines, objects, etc
ROW.label: Draftsman

ROW.definition: A person or organization to which authorship has been dubiously or incorrectly ascribed
ROW.label: Dubious author

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by revising or elucidating the content, e.g., adding an introduction, notes, or other critical matter. An editor may also prepare a resource for production, publication, or distribution. For major revisions, adaptations, etc., that substantially change the nature and content of the original work, resulting in a new work, see author
ROW.label: Editor

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a collective or aggregate work by selecting and putting together works, or parts of works, by one or more creators. For compilations of data, information, etc., that result in new works, see compiler
ROW.label: Editor of compilation

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for assembling, arranging, and trimming film, video, or other moving image formats, including both visual and audio aspects
ROW.label: Editor of moving image work

ROW.definition: A person responsible for setting up a lighting rig and focusing the lights for a production, and running the lighting at a performance
ROW.label: Electrician
ROW.variant3: Chief electrician; House electrician; Master electrician

ROW.definition: A person or organization who creates a duplicate printing surface by pressure molding and electrodepositing of metal that is then backed up with lead for printing
ROW.label: Electrotyper

ROW.definition: A jurisdiction enacting a law, regulation, constitution, court rule, etc.
ROW.label: Enacting jurisdiction

ROW.definition: A person or organization that is responsible for technical planning and design, particularly with construction
ROW.label: Engineer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who cuts letters, figures, etc. on a surface, such as a wooden or metal plate used for printing
ROW.label: Engraver

ROW.definition: A person or organization who produces text or images for printing by subjecting metal, glass, or some other surface to acid or the corrosive action of some other substance
ROW.label: Etcher

ROW.definition: A place where an event such as a conference or a concert took place
ROW.label: Event place

ROW.definition: A person or organization in charge of the description and appraisal of the value of goods, particularly rare items, works of art, etc.
ROW.label: Expert

ROW.definition: A person or organization that executed the facsimile
ROW.label: Facsimilist

ROW.definition: A person or organization that manages or supervises the work done to collect raw data or do research in an actual setting or environment (typically applies to the natural and social sciences)
ROW.label: Field director

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is identified as the only party or the party of the first party. In the case of transfer of rights, this is the assignor, transferor, licensor, grantor, etc. Multiple parties can be named jointly as the first party
ROW.label: First party

ROW.definition: A person or organization who makes or imitates something of value or importance, especially with the intent to defraud
ROW.label: Forger

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization formerly having legal possession of an item (i.e., a specific copy or instance of a resource)
ROW.label: Former owner

ROW.definition: A person or organization that furnished financial support for the production of the work
ROW.label: Funder

ROW.definition: A person responsible for geographic information system (GIS) development and integration with global positioning system data
ROW.label: Geographic information specialist

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization honored by a work or item (e.g., the honoree of a festschrift, a person to whom a copy is presented)
ROW.label: Honoree

ROW.definition: A person providing decoration to a specific item using precious metals or color, often with elaborate designs and motifs
ROW.label: Illuminator

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by supplementing the primary content with drawings, diagrams, photographs, etc. If the work is primarily the artistic content created by this entity, use artist
ROW.label: Illustrator

ROW.definition: A person who has written a statement of dedication or gift
ROW.label: Inscriber

ROW.definition: A person, family or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by responding to an interviewer, usually a reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent
ROW.label: Interviewee

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating or contributing to a resource by acting as an interviewer, reporter, pollster, or some other information gathering agent
ROW.label: Interviewer

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a new device or process
ROW.label: Inventor

ROW.definition: A person, family or organization issuing the work, such as an official organ of the body
ROW.label: Issuing body

ROW.definition: A person who hears and decides on legal matters in court.
ROW.label: Judge

ROW.definition: A jurisdiction governed by a law, regulation, etc., that was enacted by another jurisdiction
ROW.label: Jurisdiction governed

ROW.definition: An organization that provides scientific analyses of material samples
ROW.label: Laboratory

ROW.definition: A person or organization that manages or supervises work done in a controlled setting or environment
ROW.label: Laboratory director

ROW.definition: A person or organization that takes primary responsibility for a particular activity or endeavor. May be combined with another relator term or code to show the greater importance this person or organization has regarding that particular role. If more than one relator is assigned to a heading, use the Lead relator only if it applies to all the relators
ROW.label: Lead

ROW.definition: A person or organization permitting the temporary use of a book, manuscript, etc., such as for photocopying or microfilming
ROW.label: Lender

ROW.definition: A person or organization who files a libel in an ecclesiastical or admiralty case
ROW.label: Libelant

ROW.definition: A person or organization against whom a libel has been filed in an ecclesiastical court or admiralty
ROW.label: Libelee

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is an original recipient of the right to print or publish
ROW.label: Licensee

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is a signer of the license, imprimatur, etc
ROW.label: Licensor

ROW.definition: A person or organization who designs the lighting scheme for a theatrical presentation, entertainment, motion picture, etc.
ROW.label: Lighting designer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who prepares the stone or plate for lithographic printing, including a graphic artist creating a design directly on the surface from which printing will be done.
ROW.label: Lithographer

ROW.definition: The place of manufacture (e.g., printing, duplicating, casting, etc.) of a resource in a published form
ROW.label: Manufacture place

ROW.definition: The entity responsible for marbling paper, cloth, leather, etc. used in construction of a resource
ROW.label: Marbler

ROW.definition: A person or organization performing the coding of SGML, HTML, or XML markup of metadata, text, etc.
ROW.label: Markup editor

ROW.definition: A person or organization primarily responsible for compiling and maintaining the original description of a metadata set (e.g., geospatial metadata set)
ROW.label: Metadata contact

ROW.definition: A person or organization that supervises compliance with the contract and is responsible for the report and controls its distribution. Sometimes referred to as the grantee, or controlling agency
ROW.label: Monitor

ROW.definition: A person who transcribes or copies musical notation
ROW.label: Music copyist

ROW.definition: A person who coordinates the activities of the composer, the sound editor, and sound mixers for a moving image production or for a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment
ROW.label: Musical director

ROW.definition: A person or organization who performs music or contributes to the musical content of a work when it is not possible or desirable to identify the function more precisely
ROW.label: Musician

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for opposing a thesis or dissertation
ROW.label: Opponent

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for organizing a meeting for which the resource is the report or proceedings
ROW.label: Organizer of meeting

ROW.definition: A person or organization performing the work, i.e., the name of a person or organization associated with the intellectual content of the work. This category does not include the publisher or personal affiliation, or sponsor except where it is also the corporate author
ROW.label: Originator

ROW.definition: A role that has no equivalent in the MARC list
ROW.label: Other

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization that currently owns an item or collection, i.e.has legal possession of a specific copy or instance of a resource
ROW.label: Owner

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the production of paper, usually from wood, cloth, or other fibrous material
ROW.label: Papermaker

ROW.definition: A person or organization that applied for a patent
ROW.label: Patent applicant

ROW.definition: A person or organization that was granted the patent referred to by the item
ROW.label: Patent holder

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for commissioning a work. Usually a patron uses his or her means or influence to support the work of artists, writers, etc. This includes those who commission and pay for individual works
ROW.label: Patron

ROW.definition: A person contributing to a resource by performing music, acting, dancing, speaking, etc., often in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc. If specific codes are used, [prf] is used for a person whose principal skill is not known or specified
ROW.label: Performer

ROW.definition: An organization (usually a government agency) that issues permits under which work is accomplished
ROW.label: Permitting agency

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a photographic work
ROW.label: Photographer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who brings a suit in a civil proceeding
ROW.label: Plaintiff

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation by preparing plates used in the production of printed images and/or text
ROW.label: Platemaker

ROW.definition: A person who is the faculty moderator of an academic disputation, normally proposing a thesis and participating in the ensuing disputation
ROW.label: Praeses

ROW.definition: A person or organization mentioned in an “X presents” credit for moving image materials and who is associated with production, finance, or distribution in some way. A vanity credit; in early years, normally the head of a studio
ROW.label: Presenter

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in manufacturing a manifestation of printed text, notated music, etc., from type or plates, such as a book, newspaper, magazine, broadside, score, etc
ROW.label: Printer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who prints illustrations from plates.
ROW.label: Printer of plates

ROW.definition: A person or organization who makes a relief, intaglio, or planographic printing surface
ROW.label: Printmaker

ROW.definition: A person or organization primarily responsible for performing or initiating a process, such as is done with the collection of metadata sets
ROW.label: Process contact

ROW.definition: An organization that is responsible for financial, technical, and organizational management of a production for stage, screen, sound recording, television, webcast, etc.
ROW.label: Production company

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for designing the overall visual appearance of a moving image production
ROW.label: Production designer

ROW.definition: A person responsible for all technical and business matters in a production
ROW.label: Production manager

ROW.definition: A person or organization associated with the production (props, lighting, special effects, etc.) of a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment
ROW.label: Production personnel

ROW.definition: The place of production (e.g., inscription, fabrication, construction, etc.) of a resource in an unpublished form
ROW.label: Production place

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for creating a computer program
ROW.label: Programmer

ROW.definition: A person or organization with primary responsibility for all essential aspects of a project, has overall responsibility for managing projects, or provides overall direction to a project manager
ROW.label: Project director

ROW.definition: A person who corrects printed matter. For manuscripts, use Corrector [crr]
ROW.label: Proofreader

ROW.definition: A person or organization who produces, publishes, manufactures, or distributes a resource if specific codes are not desired (e.g. [mfr], [pbl])
ROW.label: Provider

ROW.definition: The place where a resource is published
ROW.label: Publication place

ROW.definition: A person or organization who presides over the elaboration of a collective work to ensure its coherence or continuity. This includes editors-in-chief, literary editors, editors of series, etc.
ROW.label: Publishing director

ROW.definition: A person contributing to a resource by supervising the technical aspects of a sound or video recording session
ROW.label: Recording engineer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who uses a recording device to capture sounds and/or video during a recording session, including field recordings of natural sounds, folkloric events, music, etc.
ROW.label: Recordist

ROW.definition: A person or organization who writes or develops the framework for an item without being intellectually responsible for its content
ROW.label: Redaktor

ROW.definition: A person or organization who prepares drawings of architectural designs (i.e., renderings) in accurate, representational perspective to show what the project will look like when completed
ROW.label: Renderer

ROW.definition: A person or organization who writes or presents reports of news or current events on air or in print
ROW.label: Reporter

ROW.definition: An organization that hosts data or material culture objects and provides services to promote long term, consistent and shared use of those data or objects
ROW.label: Repository

ROW.definition: A person who directed or managed a research project
ROW.label: Research team head

ROW.definition: A person who participated in a research project but whose role did not involve direction or management of it
ROW.label: Research team member

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for performing research
ROW.label: Researcher

ROW.definition: A person or organization who makes an answer to the courts pursuant to an application for redress (usually in an equity proceeding) or a candidate for a degree who defends or opposes a thesis provided by the praeses in an academic disputation
ROW.label: Respondent

ROW.definition: A person or organization legally responsible for the content of the published material
ROW.label: Responsible party

ROW.definition: A person or organization, other than the original choreographer or director, responsible for restaging a choreographic or dramatic work and who contributes minimal new content
ROW.label: Restager

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for the set of technical, editorial, and intellectual procedures aimed at compensating for the degradation of an item by bringing it back to a state as close as possible to its original condition
ROW.label: Restorationist

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the review of a book, motion picture, performance, etc.
ROW.label: Reviewer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for parts of a work, often headings or opening parts of a manuscript, that appear in a distinctive color, usually red
ROW.label: Rubricator

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is the author of a motion picture screenplay, generally the person who wrote the scenarios for a motion picture during the silent era
ROW.label: Scenarist

ROW.definition: A person or organization who brings scientific, pedagogical, or historical competence to the conception and realization on a work, particularly in the case of audio-visual items
ROW.label: Scientific advisor

ROW.definition: A person who is an amanuensis and for a writer of manuscripts proper. For a person who makes pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac]
ROW.label: Scribe

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is identified as the party of the second part. In the case of transfer of right, this is the assignee, transferee, licensee, grantee, etc. Multiple parties can be named jointly as the second party
ROW.label: Second party

ROW.definition: A person or organization who is a recorder, redactor, or other person responsible for expressing the views of a organization
ROW.label: Secretary

ROW.definition: A person who translates the rough sketches of the art director into actual architectural structures for a theatrical presentation, entertainment, motion picture, etc. Set designers draw the detailed guides and specifications for building the set
ROW.label: Set designer

ROW.definition: An entity in which the activity or plot of a work takes place, e.g. a geographic place, a time period, a building, an event
ROW.label: Setting

ROW.definition: A person whose signature appears without a presentation or other statement indicative of provenance. When there is a presentation statement, use Inscriber [ins].
ROW.label: Signer

ROW.definition: A person who produces and reproduces the sound score (both live and recorded), the installation of microphones, the setting of sound levels, and the coordination of sources of sound for a production
ROW.label: Sound designer

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization sponsoring some aspect of the resource, e.g., funding research, sponsoring an event
ROW.label: Sponsor

ROW.definition: A person or organization contributing to a stage resource through the overall management and supervision of a performance
ROW.label: Stage director

ROW.definition: A person who is in charge of everything that occurs on a performance stage, and who acts as chief of all crews and assistant to a director during rehearsals
ROW.label: Stage manager

ROW.definition: An organization responsible for the development or enforcement of a standard
ROW.label: Standards body

ROW.definition: A person or organization who creates a new plate for printing by molding or copying another printing surface
ROW.label: Stereotyper

ROW.definition: A person or organization that supports (by allocating facilities, staff, or other resources) a project, program, meeting, event, data objects, material culture objects, or other entities capable of support
ROW.label: Supporting host

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a cartographic resource by providing measurements or dimensional relationships for the geographic area represented
ROW.label: Surveyor

ROW.definition: A person who is ultimately in charge of scenery, props, lights and sound for a production
ROW.label: Technical director

ROW.definition: A person under whose supervision a degree candidate develops and presents a thesis, mémoire, or text of a dissertation
ROW.label: Thesis advisor

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a resource by changing it from one system of notation to another. For a work transcribed for a different instrument or performing group, see Arranger [arr]. For makers of pen-facsimiles, use Facsimilist [fac]
ROW.label: Transcriber

ROW.definition: A person or organization who renders a text from one language into another, or from an older form of a language into the modern form
ROW.label: Translator

ROW.definition: A person or organization who designs the type face used in a particular item
ROW.label: Type designer

ROW.definition: A person or organization primarily responsible for choice and arrangement of type used in an item. If the typographer is also responsible for other aspects of the graphic design of a book (e.g., Book designer [bkd]), codes for both functions may be needed
ROW.label: Typographer

ROW.definition: A place where a university that is associated with a resource is located, for example, a university where an academic dissertation or thesis was presented
ROW.label: University place

ROW.definition: A person in charge of a video production, e.g. the video recording of a stage production as opposed to a commercial motion picture. The videographer may be the camera operator or may supervise one or more camera operators. Do not confuse with cinematographer
ROW.label: Videographer

ROW.definition: A person who verifies the truthfulness of an event or action
ROW.label: Witness

ROW.definition: A person or organization who makes prints by cutting the image in relief on the end-grain of a wood block
ROW.label: Wood engraver

ROW.definition: A person or organization who makes prints by cutting the image in relief on the plank side of a wood block
ROW.label: Woodcutter

ROW.definition: A person or organization who writes significant material which accompanies a sound recording or other audiovisual material
ROW.label: Writer of accompanying material

ROW.definition: A person, family, or corporate body contributing to an expression of a work by providing an interpretation or critical explanation of the original work
ROW.label: Writer of added commentary

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization contributing to a non-textual resource by providing text for the non-textual work (e.g., writing captions for photographs, descriptions of maps).
ROW.label: Writer of added text

ROW.definition: An architect responsible for creating landscape works. This work involves coordinating the arrangement of existing and proposed land features and structures
ROW.label: Landscape architect

ROW.definition: A person or organization whose work is largely quoted or extracted in works to which he or she did not contribute directly. Such quotations are found particularly in exhibition catalogs, collections of photographs, etc.
ROW.label: Author in quotations or text abstracts

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for an afterword, postface, colophon, etc. but who is not the chief author of a work
ROW.label: Author of afterword, colophon, etc.

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for the dialog or spoken commentary for a screenplay or sound recording
ROW.label: Author of dialog

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for an introduction, preface, foreword, or other critical introductory matter, but who is not the chief author
ROW.label: Author of introduction, etc.

ROW.definition: An author of a libretto of an opera or other stage work, or an oratorio
ROW.label: Librettist

ROW.definition: An author of the words of a non-dramatic musical work (e.g. the text of a song), except for oratorios
ROW.label: Lyricist

ROW.definition: An author of a screenplay, script, or scene
ROW.label: Screenwriter

ROW.definition: An artist responsible for creating a three-dimensional work by modeling, carving, or similar technique
ROW.label: Sculptor

ROW.definition: A complainant who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding
ROW.label: Complainant-appellant

ROW.definition: A complainant against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding
ROW.label: Complainant-appellee

ROW.definition: A contestant who takes an appeal from one court of law or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Contestant-appellant

ROW.definition: A contestant against whom an appeal is taken from one court of law or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Contestant-appellee

ROW.definition: A contestee who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Contestee-appellant

ROW.definition: A contestee against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Contestee-appellee

ROW.definition: A curator who lists or inventories the items in an aggregate work such as a collection of items or works
ROW.label: Collection registrar

ROW.definition: A curator who brings together items from various sources that are then arranged, described, and cataloged as a collection. A collector is neither the creator of the material nor a person to whom manuscripts in the collection may have been addressed
ROW.label: Collector

ROW.definition: A defendant who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal action
ROW.label: Defendant-appellant

ROW.definition: A defendant against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal action
ROW.label: Defendant-appellee

ROW.definition: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a filmed performance
ROW.label: Film director

ROW.definition: A person, family or organization responsible for creating an independent or personal film. A filmmaker is individually responsible for the conception and execution of all aspects of the film
ROW.label: Filmmaker

ROW.definition: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a radio program
ROW.label: Radio director

ROW.definition: A director responsible for the general management and supervision of a television program
ROW.label: Television director

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization involved in distributing a moving image resource to theatres or other distribution channels
ROW.label: Film distributor

ROW.definition: A person who, following the script and in creative cooperation with the Director, selects, arranges, and assembles the filmed material, controls the synchronization of picture and sound, and participates in other post-production tasks such as sound mixing and visual effects processing. Today, picture editing is often performed digitally.
ROW.label: Film editor

ROW.definition: An engraver responsible for decorations, illustrations, letters, etc. cut on a metal surface for printing or decoration
ROW.label: Metal-engraver

ROW.definition: A former owner of an item who donated that item to another owner
ROW.label: Donor

ROW.definition: A former owner of an item who sold that item to another owner
ROW.label: Seller

ROW.definition: An organization hosting an event, exhibit, conference, etc., which gave rise to the resource, but having little or no responsibility for the content of the resource
ROW.label: Host institution

ROW.definition: A libelant who takes an appeal from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Libelant-appellant

ROW.definition: A libelant against whom an appeal is taken from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Libelant-appellee

ROW.definition: A libelee who takes an appeal from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Libelee-appellant

ROW.definition: A libelee against whom an appeal is taken from one ecclesiastical court or admiralty to another to reverse the judgment
ROW.label: Libelee-appellee

ROW.definition: A current owner of an item who deposited the item into the custody of another person, family, or organization, while still retaining ownership
ROW.label: Depositor

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by acting as a cast member or player in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.
ROW.label: Actor

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a work by providing interpretation, analysis, or a discussion of the subject matter on a recording, film, or other audiovisual medium
ROW.label: Commentator

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a musical resource by leading a performing group (orchestra, chorus, opera, etc.) in a musical or dramatic presentation, etc.
ROW.label: Conductor

ROW.definition: A performer who dances in a musical, dramatic, etc., presentation
ROW.label: Dancer

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) that includes other guests, performers, etc. (e.g., talk show host)
ROW.label: Host

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by playing a musical instrument
ROW.label: Instrumentalist

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by leading a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion
ROW.label: Moderator

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by reading or speaking in order to give an account of an act, occurrence, course of events, etc
ROW.label: Narrator

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to an expression of a work by appearing on screen in nonfiction moving image materials or introductions to fiction moving image materials to provide contextual or background information. Use when another term (e.g., narrator, host) is either not applicable or not desired
ROW.label: Onscreen presenter

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by participating in a program (often broadcast) where topics are discussed, usually with participation of experts in fields related to the discussion
ROW.label: Panelist

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by manipulating, controlling, or directing puppets or marionettes in a moving image production or a musical or dramatic presentation or entertainment
ROW.label: Puppeteer

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by using his/her/their voice, with or without instrumental accompaniment, to produce music. A singer’s performance may or may not include actual words
ROW.label: Singer

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by speaking words, such as a lecture, speech, etc.
ROW.label: Speaker

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by relaying a creator’s original story with dramatic or theatrical interpretation
ROW.label: Storyteller

ROW.definition: A performer contributing to a resource by giving instruction or providing a demonstration
ROW.label: Teacher

ROW.definition: A plaintiff who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal proceeding
ROW.label: Plaintiff-appellant

ROW.definition: A plaintiff against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in a legal proceeding
ROW.label: Plaintiff-appellee

ROW.definition: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a film
ROW.label: Film producer

ROW.definition: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a radio program
ROW.label: Radio producer

ROW.definition: A producer responsible for most of the business aspects of a television program
ROW.label: Television producer

ROW.definition: A person or organization that has exclusive or shared marketing rights for a resource
ROW.label: Distributor

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for printing, duplicating, casting, etc. a resource
ROW.label: Manufacturer

ROW.definition: A person, family, or organization responsible for most of the business aspects of a production for screen, sound recording, television, webcast, etc. The producer is generally responsible for fund raising, managing the production, hiring key personnel, arranging for distributors, etc.
ROW.label: Producer

ROW.definition: A person or organization responsible for publishing, releasing, or issuing a resource
ROW.label: Publisher

ROW.definition: A respondent who takes an appeal from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding
ROW.label: Respondent-appellant

ROW.definition: A respondent against whom an appeal is taken from one court or jurisdiction to another to reverse the judgment, usually in an equity proceeding
ROW.label: Respondent-appellee

ROW.definition: A writer of words added to an expression of a musical work. For lyric writing in collaboration with a composer to form an original work, see lyricist
ROW.label: Writer of added lyrics
